description: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,k) = number of positive integers that divide both n and k.
comments: T(n,k) = A000005(A050873(n,k)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 28 2010The function T(n,k) is defined for all integer n, k but only the values for 1<=k<=n as a triangular array are listed here.
formula: T(n,k) = T(k,n) = T(-n,k) = T(n,-k) = T(n,n+k) = T(n+k,k). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 18 2011
mathematica: T[ n_, k_] := Length[Intersection[Divisors @ If[n == 0, 1, n], Divisors @ If[k == 0, 1, k]]] (* _Michael Somos_, Jul 18 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) {T(n, k) = sum( i=1, min( abs(n), abs(k)),(n%i == 0) && (k%i == 0))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 18 2011 */
crossrefs: Sum of numbers in row n matches A000203. Sum of numbers in first n rows matches A024916.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
